page.title: 02CRAIGLUSCAR RESERVOIRS
page.content: CRAIGLUSCAR HAS THREE RESERVOIRS,THE COMPENSATION RESEVOIR AND THE EAST AND WEST STORAGE RESERVOIRS. ALL THREE RESERVOIRS LIE TO THE SOUTH EAST OF CRAIGLUSCAR HILL. EAST AND WEST STORE RESERVOIRS WERE BUILT IN THE 1880'S BUT ARE NO LONGER USED FOR PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY BUT ARE STILL MAINTAINED AND SERVICED BY THE FIFE REGIONAL COUNCIL. THEY COVER AN AREA OF 22.6 ACRES AND HAVE A TOP WATER LEVEL OF 490ft ABOVE SEA LEVEL WITH AN AVERAGE RAINFALL OF 38.5 INCHES. THE COMPENSATION RESERVOIR WAS USED AS A BACK UP SYSTEM IT COVERS A TOTAL AREA OF 19.5 ACRES. THE COMPENSATION RESERVOIR LIES LOWER THAN THE EAST AND WEST THUS RESULTING IN AN AVERAGE RAINFALL LOWER THAN THAT OF THE EAST AND WEST RESERVOIRS. DUE TO POOR UPKEEP AND CONDITION IT MAY BE CLOSED
